name: Tuza's Conjecture for Split Graphs
description: Split graphs are graphs whose vertices can be partitioned into a clique K and an independent set I. Threshold graphs (a subclass) are proven. General split graphs remain open.

threshold_graphs.statement: Tuza's conjecture holds for threshold graphs (nested neighborhood structure)

split_graphs.note: General split graphs NOT covered by threshold result

key_structural_insight: In a split graph G = (K ∪ I, E): All triangles have ≥2 vertices in K. Triangle structure is simpler than general graphs.

connection_to_our_lemmas.intersecting_triangles: Our Lemma 2.2 (triangles through edge share vertices) applies
